name: The Exodus Journey
description: The miraculous journey of Israel from Egyptian bondage to the Promised Land

waypoints.name: Goshen
waypoints.description: The land where the Israelites lived in Egypt before the Exodus
waypoints.significance: Starting point of the Exodus journey; place of both blessing and bondage

waypoints.name: Red Sea Crossing
waypoints.description: The miraculous crossing point where God parted the waters
waypoints.significance: Site of God's great deliverance and Pharaoh's defeat

waypoints.name: Mount Sinai
waypoints.description: The mountain where Moses received the Ten Commandments
waypoints.significance: Place of covenant-making and law-giving

waypoints.name: Kadesh Barnea
waypoints.description: Oasis where Israel spent much of their wilderness wandering
waypoints.significance: Place of rebellion and judgment; turning point in wilderness journey

waypoints.name: Jericho
waypoints.description: First city conquered in the Promised Land
waypoints.significance: Symbol of God's power and faithfulness in conquest

historicalContext: God's deliverance of His people from slavery and formation as a nation

name: Paul's First Missionary Journey
description: Paul and Barnabas's pioneering mission to Cyprus and Asia Minor

waypoints.name: Antioch
waypoints.description: Base of operations for Paul's missionary journeys
waypoints.significance: First place believers were called Christians; missionary sending center

waypoints.name: Salamis, Cyprus
waypoints.description: First stop on Paul's first missionary journey
waypoints.significance: Beginning of systematic Gentile evangelization

waypoints.name: Lystra
waypoints.description: City where Paul was stoned and left for dead
waypoints.significance: Place of suffering and Timothy's hometown

historicalContext: First systematic evangelization of Gentiles; establishment of churches in Asia Minor

name: Paul's Second Missionary Journey
description: Paul's mission that brought the Gospel to Europe

waypoints.name: Antioch
waypoints.description: Base of operations for Paul's missionary journeys
waypoints.significance: First place believers were called Christians; missionary sending center

waypoints.name: Lystra
waypoints.description: City where Paul was stoned and left for dead
waypoints.significance: Place of suffering and Timothy's hometown

waypoints.name: Philippi
waypoints.description: First European city evangelized by Paul
waypoints.significance: Gateway to Europe; Lydia's conversion; Paul and Silas imprisoned

waypoints.name: Athens
waypoints.description: Intellectual center where Paul preached at the Areopagus
waypoints.significance: Philosophical engagement with Greek culture

waypoints.name: Corinth
waypoints.description: Major commercial city where Paul spent 18 months
waypoints.significance: Strategic ministry center; recipient of two major epistles

historicalContext: Gospel reaches Europe; major churches established in Greece

name: Paul's Third Missionary Journey
description: Paul's extended ministry in Ephesus and final visit to established churches

waypoints.name: Antioch
waypoints.description: Base of operations for Paul's missionary journeys
waypoints.significance: First place believers were called Christians; missionary sending center

waypoints.name: Ephesus
waypoints.description: Major city where Paul ministered for three years
waypoints.significance: Center of Asian ministry; site of great revival and opposition

waypoints.name: Corinth
waypoints.description: Major commercial city where Paul spent 18 months
waypoints.significance: Strategic ministry center; recipient of two major epistles

waypoints.name: Philippi
waypoints.description: First European city evangelized by Paul
waypoints.significance: Gateway to Europe; Lydia's conversion; Paul and Silas imprisoned

historicalContext: Consolidation of churches; major epistles written; preparation for Jerusalem

name: Jesus's Ministry Journey
description: Key locations in Jesus's earthly ministry

waypoints.name: Nazareth
waypoints.description: Jesus's hometown where He grew up
waypoints.significance: Place of Jesus's upbringing and early rejection

waypoints.name: Capernaum
waypoints.description: Jesus's ministry headquarters by the Sea of Galilee
waypoints.significance: Center of Galilean ministry; many miracles performed here

waypoints.name: Jerusalem
waypoints.description: Holy city; site of Jesus's crucifixion and resurrection
waypoints.significance: Center of Jewish worship; site of salvation accomplished

historicalContext: The incarnate Son of God's earthly ministry, death, and resurrection
